resources.string: Rubik\'s Easy Assistant
Impossible Game
Retry
Click again to exit
Before of start
How to build a Rubik\'s Cube 3x3

Welcome to my mobile app that offers step-by-step instructions for assembling the Rubik\'s Cube 3x3 using the easiest method known as the 'beginner's method' among speedcubers. Let's dive into the process:
Building the Right Cross on the Top Layer.
Assembling All Four Corners of the Top Layer.
Assembling the Middle Layer (Belt).
Intercepting the Cube and Assembling the Cross.
Orienting the Puzzle Edges.
Placing Three Corners in Their Respective Positions.
Rotating the Triangle Corners Clockwise or Counterclockwise.
A Brief Guide to the Side Names on the 3x3 Cube:
For the 6-letter terms used, there will of course be movements that have the following meanings:
The illustration below showcases all sides of the Rubik\'s puzzle with schematic representations and corresponding names.
U : Up or twist the top to the left
D : Down or twist the lower part to the right
R : Right or twist the right part up
L : Left or twist the left side down
F : Front or rotate the front in a clockwise direction
B : Back or turn the back clockwise
Naming the Elements on the 3x3 Cube:
In this step-by-step assembly instructions, we refer to specific elements. Here\'s a depiction of the Rubik's 3x3 puzzle with labeled positions and elements.
The list of all elements of the Rubik\'s 3x3 puzzle:
Center: The central piece.
Edge: The side pieces connecting the center and corner elements.
Corner: The corner pieces, also known as corner elements.
Top Layer: The first layer or the top portion of the cube.
Middle Layer: The layer between the top and bottom layers.
Bottom Layer: The lowest layer or bottom row.
With the understanding of the terms and arrangement of elements on the Rubik\'s Cube 3x3, we can now proceed to the assembly diagrams.
This mobile app makes assembling the Rubik\'s Cube 3x3 an easy task.
